intro: Saussurea leucota, commonly known as the white saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and dense, fluffy inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a hairy texture. Saussurea leucota is often found in alpine and subalpine meadows at high elevations.
